FuncDef: This command enables the lockout mechanism for the IPsec tunnel. The system will lock out an IPsec client for the configured time interval if the number of failed authentications exceeds the configured value within the specified duration. This command only applies when the system acts as a tunnel responder.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the maximum number of failed authentications allowed during the duration-minutes interval. Values-1 to 64. ParamDefault: Default- 3
Specifies the interval of time, in minutes, during which the configured failed authentication count must be exceeded in order to trigger a lockout. Values-1 to 60. ParamDefault: Default- 5
Specifies the number of minutes that the client is blocked if the configured failed authentication count is exceeded. Values-1 to 1440, infinite. ParamDefault: Default- 10
Specifies the maximum number of ports allowed behind the same IP address. Values-1 to 32000. ParamDefault: Default- 16
